Pakistan
The Lady Health Worker (LHW) programme started in 1994, expanding to 100 000 LHWs 
by 2002/3 (40), at about 1:1000 people, or about 1:150 households; the aim was 1:200 
households. An evaluation found that they worked approximately 30 hours/week, with about 
25 household visits per week (41). LHW supervisors were at a ratio of about 1:20â€“25.
